executable.title: Mesh From Image with Spherical Samples
executable.description:
Create a mesh from spherical samples using tessellation.
\ Examples: 
\ MeshFromSphericalFunctionTessellatedSamples eapTrue_r0.015.nii.gz -o eapTrue_r0.015_vis.vtk ../directions_t4.txt --scale 1e-5 
\ MeshFromSphericalFunctionTessellatedSamples eapTrue_r0.015.nii.gz ../directions_t4.txt --scale 1e-5 
\ MeshFromSphericalFunctionTessellatedSamples odfTrue.nii.gz -o odfTrue_vis.vtk ../directions_t4.txt --scale 1.5

file.name: _OutputFile
file.label: Output File
file.description: Output vtk file. If it is not set, visualize the vtk file.

file.name: _OrientationsFile
file.description: text file which contains orientations for spherical samples. \ It is from a tessellation in whole sphere or a hemisphere. \ The sample order can be different from stored tessellation.

string-enumeration.name: _Normalization
string-enumeration.label: Normalization
string-enumeration.description: Perform normalization after removing negative values (if set); NONE: No normalization; MIN_MAX: Min-max normalization; UNIT_MAX: Unit maximum; UNIT_INTEGRATION: Unit integration.

integer-vector.name: _Flip
integer-vector.label: views
integer-vector.description: Flip x/y/z-axis for spherical functions. 1 means flip, 0 means no-flip.

integer-vector.name: _BoxView
integer-vector.label: views
integer-vector.description: only generate mesh from a given box (x0,x1,y0,y1,z0,z1). When -1 is used, then x0/y0/z0 will be 0, x1/y1/z1 will be the maximal number in the x/y/z-axis.

integer-vector.name: _SliceView
integer-vector.label: views
integer-vector.description: coordinates for coronal, sagittal and transverse views. When -1 is used for x/y/z, then the voxel is visible in the x/y/z-axis.

integer-vector.name: _WindowSize
integer-vector.description: window size. Used when visualzing the vtk file.

double-vector.name: _Angle
double-vector.description: azimuth,elevation. Used when visualzing the vtk file.

string.name: _PNGFile
string.description: output png file. Used when visualzing the vtk file.

double.name: _Zoom
double.description: zoom factor. Used when visualzing the vtk file.
